page.title: 15THE RECTOR OF ECCLESTON
page.content: {Rev Peter Aspden}has been Rector of St. Mary's, Eccleston for 6years when he{succeeded Rev. Dick Bretherton {Hawkshead-Talbot,}rector from 1958 to 1978 and who had himself succeeded his brother, rector from 1919 to 1958. He lives in new{rectory}built in alongside the older 18th C one now known as Eccleston Hall. He is chairman of governors of{St. {Mary's CE Primary School,}vice- president of the local cricket club and takes a keen interest in local affairs. He takes three church services on Sundays but the numbers coming are less than they used to be; he said that children are losing interest in the Church. Working with children, taking communion services and sick and hospital visiting give him most satisfaction.
